definitions: A moral principle stating that inaction in the face of injustice allows wickedness to prevail.
The idea that silence or passivity from moral people is the primary cause of societal decay.
examples: He urged the citizens to vote, reminding them that the only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
History shows that the only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
lemma: the only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing
synonyms: evil prospers when good men do nothing
source: the only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing!
